definition: not yet/did not/have not/not/8th earthly branch: 1-3 p.m., 6th solar month (7th July-6th August), year of the Sheep/ancient Chinese compass point: 210°
to excuse sb/to exempt/to remove or dismiss from office/to avoid/to avert/to escape/to be prohibited

sentences.english: It was petty for her not to accept the apology.
sentences.chinese: 她不接受道歉，心胸未免有些狭窄。

sentences.english: We take too much upon ourselves if we believe that, Simplicio.
sentences.chinese: 辛普利西若是相信此说人类未免也太看重自己了。

sentences.english: I don't mind a practical joke within limits but this is going too far.
sentences.chinese: 我不反对适度的恶作剧，可是这未免太过分了。

sentences.english: I thought what a waste it would be to go back now.
sentences.chinese: 我认为现在就回去未免太不划算了。

sentences.english: And summer's lease hath all too short a date.
sentences.chinese: 夏季的日子又未免太短暂。

sentences.english: Carefully push aside those, was to mow to harm her face.
sentences.chinese: 小心的扒开那些草丛，未免割伤了她的脸蛋。

sentences.english: Hitting gold so fast would have been too easy, he told himself ruefully.
sentences.chinese: 这么快就撞上金牌未免太简单了，他遗憾地告诉自己。

sentences.english: He is too clever by half, is that young man; one of these days he'll come a cropper .
sentences.chinese: 这小伙子未免太聪明了一点，总有一天他要栽跟头的。

sentences.english: "Reaching conclusions based on just three days of trading is sophomoric," he writes.
sentences.chinese: 仅凭3天的交易情况就得出结论，未免太过幼稚。

sentences.english: Such episodes make talk of reform ring hollow.
sentences.chinese: 事已至此，再谈改革未免空洞。

sentences.english: It's foolish of him to go alone.
Some may find this self-exploration a little indulgent.
sentences.chinese: 有些人或许会认为这种自我探究未免有点自我沉溺。

sentences.english: In this way, the so-called assets declaration system also too formalistic doctrine.
sentences.chinese: 这样，所谓的财产申报制度也就未免流于形式主义。

sentences.english: The anti-Puritan attack was recklessly over-stated.
sentences.chinese: 过去反清教徒的言论未免过火。

sentences.english: It is too moralistic to condemn new lifestyles.
sentences.chinese: 谴责新的生活方式未免有些上纲上线。

definition: more than one would wish/somewhat/a bit too (old, contrived, distracting etc)
unlikely to go so far as to/not as bad as
hard to avoid/difficult to escape from/will inevitably
to force someone to do something
returning to our main topic,.../that said,.../again,.../in this connection/in passing/nevertheless,.../anyhow
